author: Suvojit Bagchi
text:
Communist Party of India-Marxist’s Bengal unit has unanimously decided to discuss the possibility of an alliance with the Congress in the forthcoming Assembly election in the State. The issue was raised and discussed in the two-day-long State Committee meeting in Kolkata, a press statement by the CPI(M) said. The opinion of the State committee will be conveyed to the party’s Central Committee and Politbureau at the next week’s meeting in Delhi.

The Left Front is discussing the strategy for the Assembly poll with various parties within the front as well as with other “Leftist parties outside the Left Front and other parties,” the statement said. In this context, the State Committee meeting was convened where it was overwhelmingly accepted in the presence of senior leaders such as Sitaram Yechury and Prakash Karat, that the Left should also discuss the issue of entering into an electoral alliance with the Congress. The statement issued by the State Committee following the meeting said so in clear terms.
title: Bengal CPI(M) to push for alliance with Cong.
